newsitem.title: USA: Dun & Bradstreet files SEC forms for units.
newsitem.headline: Dun & Bradstreet files SEC forms for units.

text.p: Dun & Bradstreet Corp said it had filed Form 10 registration statements for Cognizant Corp and ACNielsen Corp with the Securities and Exchange Commission as part of its plans to split itself up into three independent companies.
"Our plan is on target for an early November spin-off of Cognizant Corporation and ACNielsen as separate, publicly traded companies," it said.
The Form 10 filings disclose historical financial results and forecasted capital structures for Cognizant Corp and ACNielsen.
The results it filed with the commission were dated up to the first half of 1996.

Dun & Bradstreet said it planned to file with the commission its Form 8-K within two weeks of the dividend declaration. The form contains summary financial information about the new Dun & Bradstreet Corp to come out of the split up.

It said it expected to declare a special dividend soon to its shareholders of one share of Cognizant common stock for each share of Dun & Bradstreet common stock, and one share of ACNielsen common stock for each three shares of Dun & Bradstreet common stock.
Once the spin-off is completed, shares of the three independent companies will trade on the New York Stock Exchange, it said.
It announced plans to split up earlier this year.

Cognizant Corp would focus on growth markets in the health care, high-tech and media industries, while ACNielsen Corp would deliver marketing research, information and analysis to the consumer products and service industries.
The new Dun & Bradstreet Corp would consist of Dun & Bradstreet Information Services, providing commercial credit and business marketing information and receivables management services.
